introduction.p: Test case steps are executed within a test case context. Steps may depend on the order in which they are executed. A sequence of steps exercizing more than one aspect of an interface object or perhaps more than one interface object, is called a scenario.
Step actions include selecting items or controls; dragging after a click to move or link an item or control with another; visual inspection to compare layouts or images.
Each step has an action, expected results and possible bug patterns.

context.p: Before attempting to write a test case step, you should be in the process of

ul.li: specifying each test case for the test script.
